references.paper_title: Particle Markov Chain Monte Carlo Methods
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the probabilistic inference methods used in the current work, providing the theoretical background for particle-based Monte Carlo methods.

references.paper_title: Scaling test-time compute with open models
references.reason: This work directly addresses inference-time scaling, proposing and evaluating methods like DVTS that are compared against in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Large Language Monkeys: Scaling Inference Compute with Repeated Sampling
references.reason: This paper explores inference-time scaling, introducing the Best-of-N method which serves as a key baseline for comparison in the current work.
This paper introduces the concept of process reward models (PRMs), which are central to the current work's approach to inference-time scaling, and provides the MATH500 dataset used for evaluation.

references.paper_title: The lessons of developing process reward models in mathematical reasoning
references.reason: This work focuses on improving the quality of PRMs, which are crucial for the success of the proposed inference-time scaling approach.
